channel.title: CVE Feed for Debian GNU/Linux -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Debian GNU/Linux -- all products

item.title: CVE-2019-3464|2024-08-04T19:12:09.438Z -- debian%20gnu%2Flinux -- rssh
item.description: Insufficient sanitization of environment variables passed to rsync can bypass the restrictions imposed by rssh, a restricted shell that should restrict users to perform only rsync operations, resulting in the execution of arbitrary shell commands.

item.title: CVE-2019-3461|2024-08-04T19:12:09.521Z -- debian%20gnu%2Flinux -- tmpreaper
item.description: Debian tmpreaper version 1.6.13+nmu1 has a race condition when doing a (bind) mount via rename() which could result in local privilege escalation. Mounting via rename() could potentially lead to a file being placed elsewhereon the filesystem hierarchy (e.g. /etc/cron.d/) if the directory being cleaned up was on the same physical filesystem. Fixed versions include 1.6.13+nmu1+deb9u1 and 1.6.14.

item.title: CVE-2019-3462|2024-08-04T19:12:09.590Z -- debian%20gnu%2Flinux -- apt%20as%20used%20in%20debian%20stretch%20and%20ubuntu
item.description: Incorrect sanitation of the 302 redirect field in HTTP transport method of apt versions 1.4.8 and earlier can lead to content injection by a MITM attacker, potentially leading to remote code execution on the target machine.

item.title: CVE-2019-3463|2024-08-04T19:12:09.435Z -- debian%20gnu%2Flinux -- rssh
item.description: Insufficient sanitization of arguments passed to rsync can bypass the restrictions imposed by rssh, a restricted shell that should restrict users to perform only rsync operations, resulting in the execution of arbitrary shell commands.
